metadata.feature_description: Main analytics dashboard showing overall community metrics including user engagement, content creation, and activity trends

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View dashboard with different time periods

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics via PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with module tabs and metrics
steps.actual: Dashboard loaded successfully showing all 6 modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) with Community Health, Engagement, Creates & Views sections

steps.action: Click on the date range selector to open time period dropdown
steps.expected: Time period options appear (Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom)
steps.actual: Time period dropdown appeared with all 5 options visible: Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom

steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show daily data
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully, date range changed to show single day view (Feb 8, 2026)

steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show monthly data
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully, date range changed to show month view (9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026)

steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show yearly data
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully, date range changed to show year view (8 Feb 2025 - 8 Feb 2026)

steps.action: Select Custom period and verify date picker
steps.expected: Custom date picker appears with start and end date calendars
steps.actual: Custom date picker appeared with two calendars for start and end dates, month/year dropdowns, and Apply button

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Compare metrics between two time periods

steps.action: Change Comparative Term dropdown from default to different value
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown shows 3 options: 1 y (year), 1 m (month), 1 w (week). Changed from 1w to 1m successfully

steps.action: Verify comparative metrics are displayed for each Community Health card
steps.expected: Each metric card shows both current percentage and comparative term percentage
steps.actual: All Community Health cards display current value (0%) and Comparative Term value (0%) side by side for easy comparison

steps.action: Review all metrics displayed on dashboard for each module
steps.expected: Metrics should display calculated percentages or N/A when data is insufficient
steps.actual: Metrics correctly display 0% for modules with no data. Ideas module correctly shows N/A for time-based metrics that require periods longer than selected (e.g., 'Ideas without change in status in over 2 weeks' shows N/A when week comparison selected)

steps.action: Verify engagement statistics show correct values
steps.expected: Engagement percentage, Interacted, Formed Relationship, and Shared counts should be displayed
steps.actual: All engagement metrics displayed correctly: Engagement 0%, Interacted 0, Formed Relationship 0, Shared 0

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test dashboard loading with no data

steps.action: View dashboard with empty analytics data
steps.expected: Dashboard should gracefully display empty state messages
steps.actual: Dashboard correctly displays empty state: All Community Health metrics show 0%, Trending Tags section shows 'No trending tags available in selected period', Popular Content section shows 'No popular content available in selected period'

steps.action: Verify charts render correctly with no data
steps.expected: Charts should render empty without errors
steps.actual: Engagement chart and Creates & Views chart both render correctly with empty data (flat lines at zero), x-axis shows days of week (MON-SUN), y-axis shows numeric scale (1-6)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test dashboard refresh with new data

steps.action: Change time period to trigger data refresh
steps.expected: Dashboard should refresh and load new data for selected period
steps.actual: Changing time period (Day, Week, Month, Year) successfully triggers dashboard refresh. Date range updates immediately and charts redraw

steps.action: Switch between different modules to verify data loading
steps.expected: Each module tab should load its specific metrics
steps.actual: All 6 modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) load correctly with their specific Community Health metrics relevant to content type

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test responsive layout on different screen sizes

steps.expected: Dashboard should adapt to narrower viewport
steps.actual: Dashboard adapts correctly to 768px width. Module tabs remain visible, Community Health cards display in scrollable horizontal layout with navigation arrows, charts resize proportionally

steps.expected: Dashboard should adapt to mobile viewport
steps.actual: Dashboard adapts to 480px mobile width. Module tabs condensed, Community Health cards use horizontal scroll with arrow navigation, content stacks vertically, all functionality remains accessible

steps.action: Click Export button on Blogs module
steps.expected: Excel file should be generated and downloaded
steps.actual: Export button clicked, file 'Blogs.xlsx' downloaded successfully to .playwright-mcp folder

steps.action: Verify all 6 module tabs are visible and clickable
steps.expected: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki tabs should be accessible
steps.actual: All 6 module tabs (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) are visible in the module selector. Each module loads with unique Community Health metrics specific to that content type

steps.action: Verify each module has unique metrics
steps.expected: Each module should display metrics relevant to its content type
steps.actual: Answers: Questions metrics (without answers, views, votes). Blogs: Blog metrics (views, comments, edits). Discussions: Topic metrics (replies, views, deleted). Events: Event metrics (views, attendees). Ideas: Idea metrics (views, votes, status changes). Wiki: Article metrics (views, interaction, deletion)

observations: The dashboard loads all 6 social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events/Social Events, Ideas, Wiki) simultaneously in a scrollable combined view

Ideas module displays N/A for certain metrics when the selected comparison period is shorter than the metric requirement (e.g., 'Ideas without change in status in over 2 weeks' requires 2+ week comparison)
Export functionality generates Excel files named after the module (e.g., 'Blogs.xlsx')
The UI maintains Comparative Term selection independently per module view
Custom date picker provides dual calendar interface with month/year dropdowns for flexible date range selection
Charts use SVG rendering for Engagement and Creates & Views line charts
Trending Tags uses horizontal bar chart visualization
All metrics correctly handle zero-data state without errors or broken UI
